text:
Venantino Venantini (17 April 1930 – 8 October 2018) was an Italian movie actor. He has appeared in over 140 movies from 1954 until his retirement in 2016. He was born in Fabriano, Italy.
Venantini was known for "No Sun in Venice" (1957), "The Agony and the Ecstasy" (1965), "Le Grand Restaurant" (1966), "Erotissimo" (1969), "The Priest's Wife" (1971), "Seven Deaths in the Cat's Eye" (1973), "Black Emanuelle" (1975), "The Concorde Affair" (1979), "Cannibal Ferox" (1981), and "Le bon roi Dagobert" (1984).
Venantini died on 8 October 2018 in Viterbo, Italy from heart surgery complications at the age of 88.

annotations.surface_form: Seven Deaths in the Cat's Eye
